newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Silver Eagle shares tumble.
newsitem.headline: Silver Eagle shares tumble.

text.p: Shares of Hong Kong footwear company Silver Eagle Holdings Ltd resumed trading with a sharp fall on Monday after the company said its financials did not support the share price.
Silver Eagle shares have risen sharply this month and trading in the stock was suspended last Thursday.
The company issued a statement on Monday saying it knew of no reason for the rise.
The stock was down HK$0.625, or 24.27 percent, in late-morning trade at HK$1.95.
"Investors are taking profit," said one sales manager at a regional brokerage.
Silver Eagle said its past losses and net asset value did not support the present price of its shares.
Before the trading suspension, the stock was trading at a premium of 256.5 times NAV per share of HK$0.01, the company said. -- Hong Kong Newsroom (852) 2843 6370
